mdRecord.dcterms:title: Traitor, spare that flag / by the Rev. J.P. Lundy. ; Air--"Woodman spare that tree."
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Lundy, John P. (John Patterson), 1823-1892
Magnus, Charles.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil war song sheet in four verses; without music. Printed in blue on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue.
First line: Traitor, spare that flag.
With advertisement "Ten illustrated Songs on Notepaper, mailed to any Address on receipt of 50 cts. Published by Chas. Magnus, 12 Frankfort St. N.Y." at bottom of sheet.
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., new York, between 1860 1nd 1867. Works which also include Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864.

Hand-colored headpiece features, on the left, a vignette of 2 women, one of whom is holding a flag with motto "The Union now and forever" and, on the right, a circular vignette of a farm scene with motto "Freedom and unity." Magnus 46. Song not listed with this headpiece in the Library Company of Philadelphia's American song sheets, cf. no. 2361ff.
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Third of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009.
